Hail fellow gamers, the name's Kiba Snowpaw, a devoted ice wolf from the frozen reaches of an ice world! Gaming for more than three decades now, with an anime and manga collection that can outshine any library's manga section, I'm here to give you my take on a game that's been sending chills down my icy fur. Also, let's clear something up first - I'm not a stranger to the "birds and bees", nor the "wolves and does", if you catch my drift. With plenty of action in the igloo (wink wink), this review, despite the game's nature, isn't written out of frustration or desperation. 😏❄️🐾  Nekopara has been on my radar for some time now. My experiences on Patreon, Kickstarter and Bandcamp, supporting indie developers' dreams with substantial investments, all funnel into my evaluation. This isn't just another notch on the bedpost; it's a passionate night with a new partner, a game that's opened up a new world of enjoyment.  Diving straight into the nitty-gritty, this game's an eroge, or an erotic game for the uninitiated. Yes, it does come with steamy scenes that might put the heat on my icy world, but that doesn't mean it lacks content elsewhere. As a hardcore gamer with a knack for an immersive storyline, let me tell you - Nekopara knows how to weave a tale.  You're in charge of a bakery and have the company of adorable anthropomorphic catgirls (referred to as Nekos) who, by the way, are wonderfully brought to life with exquisite animation. The game, with its captivating characters, pleasing music, and lively voice acting, does an excellent job of recreating the atmosphere of a bustling bakery. And, a little pro tip for my fellow eroge adventurers out there: there's a boob bounce slider that defies physics if you want it to. Just sayin'... 🎮🐱💕  Now, it's easy to get lost in the... ahem... physical aspects of Nekopara. But, let's not forget about the intriguing plot that pulls the heartstrings at the right moments. These Nekos aren't merely human-feline hybrids bred for amusement. They come with their own histories, dilemmas, and insecurities. The game's society deals with complex issues such as abandonment, compliance tests, and GPS tracking that add depth to this supposed erotic escapade. It's a unique amalgamation of dystopia, ethics, and human-feline relationships.  Given the darker undertones, Nekopara might make you question the reality of this seemingly utopian world. It's akin to a cute, fuzzy, and sexy version of Brave New World meets The Handmaid's Tale.  However, folks, let's remember that at the end of the day, it's a game, and a darned good one at that. I've navigated the plains of Azeroth, conquered the universe in Mass Effect, fought off the Covenant in Halo, and Nekopara stands proud in this illustrious company. Why? Because it does something different and pulls it off spectacularly.  There's a special place in my heart (and my Steam library) for games that offer something more than just mindless action or soulless erotica, and Nekopara is one of them. The art, story, and interaction all combine to make a game that's worthy of the hundreds, if not thousands, of hours you'll lose within its world. 🐾💗🎮  So, whether you're an eroge veteran like yours truly or a curious newcomer, Nekopara is worth your time. There are many worlds to conquer, quests to undertake, and catgirls to... ahem... meet, but remember: it's not about the destination, it's about the journey.  Stay frosty, gamers! Remember to always enjoy the game and embrace what makes it unique. This is Kiba Snowpaw, your furry friend from the ice world, signing off after another frostbitten gaming night. Until next time! 🐺❄️🎮  #FurryVerdict #KibaReviews #IceWolfGamer #Nekopara #StayFrosty  [Score: 100 Boob bounces out of 100 🐾🎮💯]

Maybe the first visual novel I have played, so I know I might sound a little harsh and perhaps even biased, please excuse that. This game is mainly made to be enjoyed by anime girl lovers, and cat girls are a huge plus. This game can definetly make you one of us cat girl enjoyers, even if you were not very inclined towards them in the past (my case, used to despise them). The plot is a little weak, nor do I like the style of visual novels (if you like vn's this should not be an issue), but the cat girls are very much cute, and the anime girl cutie energy is there. The h-scenes follows the visual novel style, so if you do not like the art style this game's magic will not work very well, and it may feel slow and boring. To summerise, you like anime girls this game will work, if do not like vn's maybe avoid this game, the h-scenes are styled like vn's, so not liking vn's will make the h-scenes crap. Important: the h-scenes have to be bought seperately as a 18+ dlc, and also press p to make their coconuts jiggle in game. Overall this game is positive for me, Happy gaming my brothers.

Nekopara is a visual novel game that features a cast of charming cat-girls that have taken over a bakery. As you progress through the game, you'll discover that the feline ladies are not only incredibly cute but also have distinct personalities and interests. The game's music and visuals add to its overall charm, making it a fun experience for players who enjoy the visual novel genre.  If you're a fan of cat-girls and enjoy a good love story, Nekopara is the game for you. However, be aware that the game has an adult-oriented DLC, which some players might enjoy. That being said, the game itself is still enjoyable without the mature content and is a great choice for those looking for a light hearted and humorous game. So, if you're looking for a purring good time, give Nekopara a try +100 for the NSFW stuff but that's only if you're into that
NEKOPARA Vol. 1 is an absolute delight for fans of visual novels and catgirls. With its charming characters, beautiful artwork, and heartwarming story, it offers a truly enjoyable and lighthearted experience. The game's cute and lovable catgirl cast, accompanied by their adorable and amusing personalities, make for a delightful journey filled with laughter and endearing moments. The captivating visual design, soothing soundtrack, and well-written dialogue create an immersive and cozy atmosphere that draws you into the world of La Soleil. Whether you're following the heartwarming interactions between the protagonist and the catgirls or exploring their unique stories, NEKOPARA Vol. 1 is a heartwarming and delightful visual novel that will leave you with a warm and fuzzy feeling. Get ready to indulge in a sweet and charming adventure that celebrates friendship, love, and the joy of having adorable feline companions. NEKOPARA Vol. 1 is a must-play for fans of romance and catgirl enthusiasts everywhere.

Nekopara Vol.1 has captured my heart and imagination like few other visual novels have. From the moment I embarked on this enchanting journey, I was transported to a world of delightful feline wonders that left me utterly mesmerized. This game is nothing short of a masterwork, seamlessly blending captivating storytelling, stunning visuals, and a charming cast of characters that rival the works of literary greats such as Tolkien and Philip K. Dick.  One of the standout features of Nekopara Vol.1 is its meticulously crafted narrative. The game takes you on a whimsical adventure filled with heartwarming moments, genuine emotion, and unexpected depth. The story follows Kashou Minaduki, a talented pastry chef, as he opens a patisserie and discovers that his charming catgirls possess more than just adorable appearances. The game skillfully explores themes of companionship, identity, and the true meaning of family, drawing players into a richly woven tapestry of emotions.  Visually, Nekopara Vol.1 is an absolute feast for the eyes. The character designs are beautifully rendered, each catgirl exuding their unique personality through their expressive eyes, delicate movements, and charming mannerisms. The meticulously detailed backgrounds create an immersive world that feels vibrant and lived-in. The combination of gorgeous artwork and smooth animations brings the characters and their interactions to life, allowing players to truly connect with them on a profound level.  Moreover, the exquisite writing in Nekopara Vol.1 is on par with the likes of legendary authors. The game's creators have masterfully crafted a dialogue that sparkles with wit, warmth, and poignant moments of reflection. The characters' conversations are both endearing and thought-provoking, adding layers of complexity to their already lovable personalities. This exceptional writing elevates the experience, making it a memorable and intellectually stimulating journey that transcends the boundaries of the visual novel genre.  In addition to its narrative prowess, Nekopara Vol.1 also boasts a stellar soundtrack that perfectly complements the storytelling. Each musical composition heightens the emotional impact of every scene, whether it's a tender moment between characters or an exhilarating turning point in the story. The melodies linger long after the game is over, evoking a sense of nostalgia and warmth that further enhances the overall experience.  Nekopara Vol.1 stands as a testament to the creativity, craftsmanship, and passion of its developers. It has the power to captivate players, drawing them into a world brimming with love, laughter, and genuine connections. Like the works of Tolkien, Philip K. Dick, and other esteemed authors, this visual novel transcends its medium, leaving an indelible mark on those who dare to venture into its charming embrace.  Nekopara Vol.1 is a masterstroke that deserves accolades and recognition for its ability to weave a heartwarming and thought-provoking tale, accompanied by breathtaking visuals and an enchanting soundtrack. It is a shining example of the power of storytelling, proving that the visual novel genre can reach the heights of literary greatness.

Anyways here is a recipe on a lemon poppyseed cheesecake  1-1/2 cups graham cracker crumbs 3 tablespoons butter, melted 4 packages (8 ounces each) cream cheese, softened 1 cup sugar 2 tablespoons all-purpose flour 2-1/2 teaspoons vanilla extract 5 large eggs, room temperature, lightly beaten 1/2 cup heavy whipping cream 1/4 cup lemon juice 1 tablespoon grated lemon zest 1/3 cup poppy seeds  Preheat oven to 350°. In a small bowl, combine graham cracker crumbs and butter. Press onto the bottom and 1 in. up the sides of a greased 9-in. springform pan. Set aside. In a large bowl, beat cream cheese, sugar, flour and vanilla until smooth. Add eggs, cream, lemon juice, zest and poppy seeds. Beat on low speed just until combined. Pour into prepared crust. Place pan on a baking sheet. Bake until center is almost set, 55-60 minutes. Cool on a wire rack for 10 minutes. Carefully run a knife around edge of pan to loosen; cool 1 hour longer. Refrigerate overnight. Remove sides of pan. Refrigerate leftovers.

Nekopara is the ultimate neko lover's dream come true! From the adorable catgirls to the heartwarming story, this game is sure to make you say "uwu" with every new scene. As a visual novel, it's one of the best Japanese games ever made, and it's easy to see why.  The art style is simply stunning, with vibrant colors and detailed character designs that bring the nekos to life. The voice acting is equally impressive, with each character having a unique voice that perfectly captures their personality. And the music is just as delightful, with catchy tunes that will have you humming along.  But what really sets Nekopara apart is its story. As you follow Kashou and his nekos, you'll be drawn into a world of friendship, love, and pastry-making. It's a heartwarming tale that will leave you feeling warm and fuzzy inside, and it's hard not to get invested in the lives of these lovable characters.  In fact, after playing Nekopara, I found myself daydreaming about becoming a manager in a patisserie just like Kashou. The game's attention to detail when it comes to pastry-making is impressive, and it's hard not to feel inspired to try your hand at baking.

Nekopara, a kinetic visual novel reputable for its NSFW DLC and memes relating to it, is a game that follows the main character Kashou taking in two major heroines -- Vanilla and Chocolate, both neko-girls -- and starting up a cafe against his father's wishes. The game is the typical rom-com type anime about a family involving numerous neko-girls, which comes with the well-known anime-esqe fanservice (young women with likable personalities).  Nekopara unfortunately does not shatter new ground to the genre and relies heavily on the "kawaii~"-ness of the main neko-girl heroines. The KVN has basic morals to its story such as [i]follow your dreams[/i] and [i]love your family[/i], but it does not feel that said morals were as fleshed out as they could of been. If you are looking for an "emotional" KVN or one that's lighthearted in its storytelling then Nekopara is fine; however, when compared to competition, it really shows its flaws.  In conclusion I would not recommend this game. There are better games out there that would better take up your time.

Nekopara is the ultimate neko lover's dream come true! From the adorable catgirls to the heartwarming story, this game is sure to make you say "uwu" with every new scene. As a visual novel, it's one of the best Japanese games ever made, and it's easy to see why.  The art style is simply stunning, with vibrant colors and detailed character designs that bring the nekos to life. The voice acting is equally impressive, with each character having a unique voice that perfectly captures their personality. And the music is just as delightful, with catchy tunes that will have you humming along.  But what really sets Nekopara apart is its story. As you follow Kashou and his nekos, you'll be drawn into a world of friendship, love, and pastry-making. It's a heartwarming tale that will leave you feeling warm and fuzzy inside, and it's hard not to get invested in the lives of these lovable characters.  In fact, after playing Nekopara, I found myself daydreaming about becoming a manager in a patisserie just like Kashou. The game's attention to detail when it comes to pastry-making is impressive, and it's hard not to feel inspired to try your hand at baking.  Overall, Nekopara is a must-play for anyone who loves cute nekos, heartwarming stories, and delicious desserts. It's easily one of the best Japanese games ever made, and it's sure to leave you with a smile on your face. So don't hesitate – grab a copy of Nekopara today and start your journey into the world of nekos and pastry-making!

Oh my catnip, let me tell you about Nekopara, the anime that's guaranteed to make you purr with delight!  Now, if you're not already a fan of catgirls, then Nekopara may not be your cup of milk. But if you are, then get ready for a meow-velous time!  The show follows the story of Kashou Minaduki, a young man who opens a patisserie and hires a bunch of catgirls to work as his assistants. And when I say catgirls, I mean girls with ears and tails who can meow and purr and do all sorts of other cute cat things.  The animation is simply purr-fect, with beautiful backgrounds and character designs that will make your whiskers tingle. And the music is so catchy, you'll be meowing along in no time!  But let's talk about the real stars of the show - the catgirls themselves! There's Chocola and Vanilla, the main catgirls who have a sweet tooth and a love for their master that's almost as strong as their love for catnip. Then there's Azuki and Coconut, the two older sisters who are more serious and responsible, but still know how to have a good time. And let's not forget about the youngest catgirls, Maple and Cinnamon, who are just too cute for words.  The interactions between the catgirls and their master are hilarious and heartwarming, and the show has just the right amount of fan service to keep things spicy without being too... ahem, racy.  Overall, Nekopara is a delightful and charming anime that will leave you feline fine. So if you're a fan of catgirls, sweets, and cute things in general, then this is the purr-fect show for you!

hot pockets
Ah, Nekopara, the so-very-famous Eroge with catgirls and "Overwhelmingly positive" reviews here on Steam and everywhere! Surprisingly the plot goes like this: Kashou runs away from home to open his own cafe and live his dream to become a baker, against his filthy rich family's will. But to his surprise, he is followed by two loyal catgirls of his household, who could not fathom living without him. This series is/was such a success that it spawned 5 games plus one OVA. Is it really all of that?  Let me confuse you for a moment and say "yes, it is". The UI is high quality, way above those cheap RenPy VNs you see around, though it uses the strange low-res (which is typical for japanese Eroge). The art is magnificent. It is richly voice acted. There is quite some character development in the whole series, even though the plot is simply about their daily lives.  The problem here are the heroines. They look, talk and act way too young. Yeah, they are cute, but in an innocent kind of way. This is an Eroge, so, c'mon. Moreover, this is not really a game, but a "kinetic novel". There are 0 choices. It is basically an anime (a hentai, if you have the R18 patch). There is one big feature that might end up being overlooked: you can have the subtitles in English AND Japanese. Quite handy if you're learning Kanji.  Achievements come from simply progressing the game. No Linux port, but worked fine on Proton (thanks Valve!). The cards from this game were once one of the most expensive on Steam but they have since chilled a bit and became more affordable.  Even though I am a raging nekophile [spoiler]someone who loves catgirls[/spoiler] I'm not recommending this one. Get this only if you're an absolute pervert. Which you might be. I'm not judging.

v good
As a VN fan, this is a pass, as it is pretty mid. If you like lewding catgirls, then this game is more up your alley. But there are better kinetic novels, better cheerful comedy VNs, and better 18+ novels if any of those are your thing:  Pros: - The art is very charming, and animations are good - Voice acting is well done - Some chapters are fairly decent, story-wise (2, 3, and 8) - Options to play in two languages at once! I love it when games let you do this  Cons: - Writing is pretty bad, most of which being repetitive padding to set up the next little comedy or erotic bit - Most of the story is pretty poorly done, with two chapters literally being copy-pastes of each other (one focused on Chocola and one focused on Vanilla) - There is some world-building and character-building that just... gets dropped? Maybe they are saving it for the later volumes - Music is fun, but way too repetitive - The 18+ content, if you choose to go that route, wasn't really worth it. It just plays out what's inferred in the game, and two of the scenes are, once again, almost copy-paste of each other  - ...... okay, I'll say it. Catgirls are mid-to-bottom tier on the nekomimi scale imo, and this game is no exception. The only exceptions to this rule are Stella Hoshi from VA-11 HALL-A and Ichigo from Tokyo Mew Mew (Edit: I forgor about Neco-Arc... please don't cancel me!)

This has to be one of my favorite games of all time, when i get bored I always seem to come back to it and it has had a chokehold on me since i started playing.  I am truly addicted to nekopara and i can't stop playing it and I will continue playing it until my fingers fall off and I cannot click anymore.  The gameplay makes me feel something, it's like a light in this darkness we call reality, it's an escape from all the troubles I have to go through on a daily basis.  The gameplay is so cute and when i see the silly little cat girls on my screen i can't help but get my legs kicking and hit a state of euphoria from the dialogue.  it's almost like i'm conversing with a real life cat girl.  This game is ahead of its time and there won't be anything like it anytime soon. I say pick this game up if you want to play through a masterpiece of a title and you definitely won't regret it.  It all started when Chocola first came on my screen followed by Vanilla and it was love at first sight.  I've never in my life looked at my computer screen and felt so immersed like I was actually there on screen.  It was truly an amazing sensual experience.
I haven't played too many visual novel type games before this but I felt like this was a quality one with good animations, physics, music, art, and videos that were utilized in a wonderful fashion. I specifically enjoyed different characters and scenes being introduced over time. I did notice that there are cut animations on the steam version that led to a few sudden jumps, the opening and ending videos failed to play, and there were a few minor graphical glitches which are going to knock it down a bit. I also wished there was more involvement with choices, even if my choices didn't impact anything, just so I can feel like I am more part of the story. Overall this was a pretty good experience that I would recommend for the price.  7/10

Nekopara is a great
I don't understand why is it Overwhelmingly Positive. Manage somehow 6 chapters. it's just boring.
"A cat is fine too..."  I want to immediatly state that i don't necesarily think NekoPara is bad or that i wouldn't recommend it to anybody, far from it. I definitely think NekoPara does everything it wants to do and does it well. Sadly it just didn't click with me at all and this review is a summary with some points as to why.  NekoPara always seemed like one of the big classic Visual Novels on Steam. Mainly because it released at a time when the Storefront didn't read like the titles of DVDs you would find in  Video rentals in a Red Light District and Visual Novels (especially H-Visual Novels) were rather scarce, so my curiousity was certainly piqued a little going into this after all these years. What i got was an expected Harem-Romance Visual Novel with hilariously high Production for a really forgettable, rather tame Love Story between a very bland, generic MC and two biologically engineered Girl-Cat Hybrids.  The art is good, the music is cheery (although a little limited) and almost the entire cast got full Voice Acting. The Portraits have a suprising amount of Animation going on and feel very lively and expressive, it was quite the pleasant suprise.  As for that cast, Chocola and Vanilla at times can come of as a little intrusive and annoying unfortunately. Chocola more so as she never seems to dial it back. Repetition happens a LOT in the entire VN and i never felt so inclined to flatout skip dialogue in a Visual Novel before. The other catgirls barely have a presence in Vol. 1. Shigure, the little sister with the hots for her big Brother the MC, gave me the creeps.  I can deal with the silly world of Catgirls existing and essentially being second class citizens but if your leads can't carry the story it ultimately becomes very monotone and boring. It overall just felt like a dime a dozen Anime Plot you have seen, read and heard lots of times before.  Also since this is technically an 18+ Game, let's briefly talk about that. Cheesy sound effects, the two girls yelling the same lines for twenty to thirty minutes repeatedly and the heavy pixelation did nothing for me in the slightest. Either i am into way more frisky and kinkier stuff or i am too old to get excited about (no pun intended) Vanilla Intercourse. Regardless i think an Asking Price of around 8 Bucks for these 18+ Patches is way too high.  To wrap up, NekoPara may be a Paradise for Catgirl Lovers, many others, especially those who want more, should probably pass on this one.

this is the worst game i have ever played, bar none. never before have i felt such excruciating torment as i did while playing through this experience. each second i spent in this nightmare realm of catgirls exponentially increased my desire to throw my entire computer away and fling myself directly into the sun. upon making it to the 5th, 6th, and 7th acts of this hellish disaster of a game, after observing the "content" this game has to offer, i felt a severe urge to claw my eyeballs out which was only compounded by each consequent scene. upon playing this game, i experienced emotions i could have never imagined prior; extreme discomfort, physical and mental torment, and severe depression are nothing compared to what i felt when opening this game and experiencing it for the first time. i would rather shove myself head-first into a meat grinder than go through the pure, concentrated hell that this game is. please, for the love of all that is holy, do not subject yourself to this torment as i did. do not purchase this game, even if it and the dlc are each on sale for $4, making it an objective steal in marketing terms. this is the worst $8 i have, and ever will, spend on anything in my entire life without a doubt. it's not worth it. i beg you to consider doing literally anything else with your time, as even sitting in your chair contemplating the universe for a trillion years would be miles more productive than playing this game. the mere six hours i spent playing this do not accurately represent the torture and torment i endured, as a lifetime of struggle in the deepest reaches of hell would be the only thing that could possibly rival this. don't subject yourself to the "cute" catgirls. they are a ploy. it's all an elaborate setup to get you to fall for it, only to lure you into its devastating trap and devour you from the inside. don't subject yourself to the horrific writing, consisting of 10 minute long scenes talking about age and shampoo and fucking whale sharks. play something meaningful that can change your life for the better, or at the very least, play something that is harmless. this game is the pure embodiment of the devil himself. hell is a welcome treat in comparison to this; so take a vacation there, and enjoy your time, knowing full well that you have escaped an obscene fate. i envy you.

I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single father to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2021 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So i decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and world and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

For a starter I cannot describe how much this game cured my crippling depression, the Nekopara Franchise has honestly cured my depression and helped me with suicidal thoughts. My depression was really bad last month as I had finished high school and becoming a shut in neat, my family kicked me out because I had become too "weird" because of my usual hobbies, I tried to explain that the anime body pillow was the only friend I need but they wouldn't listen. After finding somewhere to move in, my room partner recommended that I try the Nekopara franchise, at first I shrugged it off but after awhile my depression got really bad and it was my friends last wish for me to try the game. The opening of the game filled me with joy as I saw 2 cat girl waifus appear on the screen that was pure eye candy. I dropped everything in my life and started sweating on this game and my depression and misery started to finally fade away after 4 years of torture. The visuals in the game are nothing special but that's one of its charms, the art of the cat girls in this game are 100% waifu content and the art style making me feel good inside. The feelings I get when I play are so mixed that it makes me feel alive again, from laughter to tears, the game makes you feel alive and that you are really there. As people say its not about the graphics that make a game good its about the story and the plot, the Nekopara series of games are far by the best story games of all time and the visuals 100% carry the story, The story follows you as Kashou Minaduki "Master" and your two cat girls Chocola And Vanilla, it makes you wish you were the MC (not Minecraft) and makes you dream you had 2 perfect cat girls at your side.   The best feature of the game is its adjustable jiggle physics, it made the immersion 100 times better and I would consider that feature one of the main reasons my depression is gone today, half way through the story my depression was almost gone and I could be found sitting in my room for hours at a time enjoying this game. The anime waifus in the game make me so happy and really feel like I am loved and at ease. when I put the game on, it brings a smile to my face and really feels me with joy. When I have bad thoughts of my abusive household I always hop on Nekopara and it makes me feel happy again. Sometimes I find my self playing this game and staring at the "holy scenes" for way to long and I'm happy to say this game has great "holy scenes" the R18+ Patch is defiantly a must buy with the game looking 9999 times better, the patch makes the game actually have character and makes the "epic scenes" 9999 times better to watch.   When I play this game I whole heartily play for the plot, don't get me wrong most people play for the "swaggy scenes" but for me I 100% play the plot, the best thing in my opinion has to be its funny use of comedy and how its attached to 2 innocent cat girls that just want "Master" to be happy. I know people way criticise me for being a odd one out for playing for the plot but its TRUE! I genuinely play for this games plot.  Now I know many people are going to be reading this review so I'm going to describe the best way of playing this game without anyone else knowing, you need to obviously need to own the game (DUH) and own a high tech trip wire laser that pulls up your pants and closes the game when activated, you should have these materials laying around but one thing that you might need to get is a good wireless mouse so you can click to advance the plot when your a "little" far from your computer, after these materials it should be self explanatory.  I know I might sound like I'm repeating my self but the game is just one of or maybe the #1 story game out there, not many other games can cure someone's depression that has been going on for many years and not many other games can bring a smile to sad mans face but I can 100% confirm this game will just do that but triple your expectations. To be honest if your reading this far into the review I think you have done yourself a favour and should be the type of person to pick up this game.  If your still reading this I think you want to know a little bit more about my mental health before playing Nekopara, to be honest I have really been suffering and when I go outside I feel like I'm being stared at all times and it doesn't help with my anxiety, When I was inside after being outside all day I feel like I cant breathe and when I got to bed my sleep paralysis demon haunts me everyday, but everything changed when I moved out and became more independent, at first when I moved out I was on the "verge" and wanted to die everyday because it got way worse but one day I got recommended a strange game called Nekopara, to be honest I wasn't having it and had zero interest playing that silly game at all but my friend wished i played it one time so i finally gave in and gave it a shot.  As a final note, I know its not just me who has used this game as a way of escaping and curing my depression, The Game is healing for me, therapeutic for sure. I hear this for lots of others too and I think it’s an absolutely beautiful phenomenon. I’ve never been one to keep up on hobbies and see them through. I always give up when I see I'm just wasting my time. I always feel too lazy to get up and do something or my depression takes over. This is not the same. I’m yearning all the time to get back in the game and fix the thing I messed up last session. I’m always wanting to see if I am just good enough to have those 2 as my waifus. I just wanted to say that I am so grateful for this game and I hope it brings you the peace and joy it brings me even as just a starter. "The end, beginning, and the present have all rejoiced in tears at what humanity has created, as beings with the capabilities of both discovering the world's great mysteries, but also bring chaos to their perception, have rained down on the timeline" -My final words before jumping off my queen's web  I hail to the spiderqueen, as I am part of her 11,000 little broodie babies. While frolicking around the fields of her majesty's silk, I happened to come across [NEKOPARA VOLUME 1] wedged between two thick white ropes. I decided I would give it a read. Chapters went by. and by. by. I webbed into a state of deep spider despair knowing that me and my 10,999 other broodie baby spider would never scribe such literature. How beautiful these pages are as they flow across my chitn appendages. How wonderful people the writers must be, knowing they have done pull ups on humanity's highest bar. Wordplay such as "big fatty tuna" and "Catpanion" would never grace the scape of a spider's mind. But, ohohoho, how the other broodies hated me for this genius. They shot meters of silk into my face saying "This is completely fucking degenerate" Dare they say that again. Now Im here, at the edge of spiderworld (which is flat) ready to fall to spider doom. Here I go. Weeeeeeeeeeeee. Thank you [NEKOPARA VOLUME 1]
neko love.
The story was cute until the cats got horny, oops.
There is a reason for Nekopara be such a recognizable game. As a visual novel every technical aspect of it is either good or excellent. Art, music, character design, bgm. All have very good quality and are extremely memorable. The dialogues, with the exception of the protagonist, are fully voice acted. On a side note this is the only vn I know that has voice, a japanese and and an english subtitle making Nekopara unironically one of the best ways to learn japanese. The story maybe the most generic aspect of the game, but even then it can still appeal to the wholesome slice of life crowd. [b]Overall would become a complete disappointment for my parents again![/b]

[h2]NekoPara[/h2] [i]It's a Neko Paradise![/i]  [h3]Preclaimer[/h3] - This is an Adult Visual Novel, designed to be R18, which is why I consider the R18 content part of the whole and will include it in this review. If for whatever reason you are not interested in this content or aren't legally allowed to play it, you should just skip this review. - Since many visual novels are similar in a bunch of ways, I'm gonna review this one on a few common aspects, including reference to other VNs aswell as giving independent explanations. - If you want a [b]full[/b] series review with glorious detail, beautiful images and more you may want to take a look [url=https://www.sinicalanimenetwork.com/post/nyan-nyan-nekoparaiten]>> here <<[/url].  [hr] [h3]Graphical & Technical Quality[/h3] The NekoPara Franchise is a well know milestone in the world of Visual Novels. Featuring an amazing artstyle that can also be seen in "The Ditzy Demons are in Love with Me", full fledged Emote Engine Live2D throughout the entire game (aka. fully animated characters), a nice soundtrack and a solid Engine foundation with a modified KiriKiri Engine version.  This gives us common features like up to 80 individual save slots whose description you can individually change, quick saving and loading, auto and skip mode with adjustable behaviour, basic customization options (which can be further changed through the hidden advanced settings) and an overall smooth performance.  NekoPara even throws it's own share of gimmicks into the mix, for example a slider setting to modify the physical behavior of a certain body area *hint hint*.  On the downside though, NekoPara is a 720p VN resulting in noteable quality loss on normal 1080p monitors in fullscreen and beyond. Also, being the oldest part of the series, it has some minor hicups like broken idle lip sync when skipping a dialogue with a running animation too fast.  [hr] [url]https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1860652564[/url]  [hr] [h3]Content & Runtime[/h3] What can you expect from NekoPara? Of course not spoiling the actual story, it is an overly cute, very lighthearted romance story with the usual amount of comedy mixed in, making it a nice game to enjoy whenever you feel the need for cute Nekos doing cute things to brighten up your mood. Except for the generic "wake up" moment of sudden emotion there isn't any real story to it, other than Slice of Life from the view of our male protagonist.  Even though, the characters have distinct personalities making them unique and offering a wide variety of archetypes you might enjoy. The male protagonist is absolute average, going with the carefree theme of the story. And while Volume 1 focusses around the first two of them, NekoPara as a whole features 6 heroines (and the wannabe heroine sister) in a perfectly peaceful harem situation.  Which brings us to the most important point: NekoPara is a completely linear novel with absolutely no choices whatsover. That means if you don't like the harem setting you have no way to get around it, and that also means the average playtime (not rush skipping) is around only 10h.  The gallery is available from the very beginning, allowing you to enjoy the 22 CGs, 7 SD artworks, 15 OSTs and all "Scenes" and movies again - as long as you already saw them ingame that is.  [hr] [url]https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1860652621[/url]  [hr] [h3]The R18 content[/h3] Even though the R18 DLC costs almost as much as the base game, it's worth it not only for the sake of having the full game.  Even in the H department NekoPara is going all out with animated (GIF loop-ish) H-scenes, 3 of them in total, and accompanying sound effects (if you like them or not is up to you, you can mute them). You also, as usual, get a few "uncensored" CGs that otherwise would have been less nude.  Though funnily someone wanted to be extra, extra careful about sharing the R18 content - even though it's still [b]mosaic censored[/b] and hence legal even in Japan - because the game itself surpresses it by auto blurring Steam screenshots from R18 scenes, switching the game to All Ages when Steam streaming and forcefully exits when trying to stream while in a said R18 scene. Though most people won't be bothered by any of that anyway.  When it comes to the depictions of bodily fluids, the inhuman stamina of the actors or even the whole act in total - let's just say it's "as unreal as a perfect catgirl harem paradise", so expect [i]a lot[/i]. Other than the absolute basic hentai amounts of SM tendencies though it's pretty vanilla.  [hr] [url]https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1860652581[/url]  [hr] [h3]Conclusion[/h3] Is this game worth it? While I do agree that NekoPara is mighty expensive, being only slightly cheaper than the average 60h multi route VN while only featuring 10h of linear story, it's still a very good VN. If you don't have something awesome of said multi route caliber in your to buy list or just have a severe craving for cute catgirls, buying the bundle in the next sale is your best bet. Unless you are too impatient, then buying it right now is an option too. As an "I'm still unsure" alternative, there is an anime level OVA version of Vol.1 (even here on Steam) which you could look into.    [code]Helpful review? Maybe take a look at [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/37389784/][u]the rest[/u][/url] of my reviews too![/code] [code]𝐅𝐨𝐥𝐥𝐨𝐰 [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/33853800/]𝐎𝐭𝐨𝐦𝐞 𝐒𝐞𝐤𝐚𝐢'𝐬 𝐂𝐮𝐫𝐚𝐭𝐨𝐫 𝐏𝐚𝐠𝐞[/url] 𝐟𝐨𝐫 𝐦𝐨𝐫𝐞 𝐕𝐢𝐬𝐮𝐚𝐥 𝐍𝐨𝐯𝐞𝐥 𝐚𝐧𝐝 𝐉𝐑𝐏𝐆 𝐑𝐞𝐯𝐢𝐞𝐰𝐬[/code]

I came for the plot.
I can feel it, trembeling inside of this body as my fragile skin starts to be torn like wool cloth. I loose control of my fingers 21 time a day and my hands are unable to hold even a feather to write with. My vision obscured by something wich resides not on top, but inside of, my eye, i see no more blues or greens or yellows or even purples, only reds, the colour of blood its the only colour it wants me to see so it pains me with blindness the times i resist it, about 21 minutes does the times of my blured vision last until it clears away and i return to my world of red and brown and black and white and mostly drab grey. The bones of my Skelletum move against my will at many times and dislocate or even break appart like brittle sticks when i attempt resistance from it. It swarms inside. Its voice comments on my behaviour, whispers its cruel orders with malicious intent or keeps quiet, but i know it looks throgh my eyes. The black spot in the upper part of the sclera of my right eye keeps growing, each morning i look into the mirror for 21 minutes and i see it, sitting there like it belongs, giving the rest of the eye a red tint from how much i rub it hoping it goes away by daybreak. I have told the doctor that the eyedrops wich i have been comanded to take are not effective and i can barely keep the eyelids apart from each other, it has been just like this for the las 21 days, but as he ignores my rant he keeps on telling me that i must not resist against the power of good, Theseus has sunk. Originally I purchased this game to play with my friends but after forcing them to play about five games in a row they all decided that they have had enough for the day. My intense desire for Monopoly wasn't satisfied so I moved on to playing against a full room of AI. After my tenth game against five hard AI I was still not satisfied but my urge had to wait as I passed out before I can start a new game. When I wake up I see my switch is at low battery so I plug it in and go straight to playing Monopoly. I played one round with five hard AI but my urge simply got worse, I figured that I wasn't getting my fill since it was so long between my turns. I decided to change it to one hard AI but after about 3 games I started to get impatient with the AI to the point that I was screaming at the top of my lungs telling this AI to hurry his turn up so that I can play. It was around this time that my mother came into my room telling me that I woke her up and that she was taking my Switch away so that she can get some sleep. Rage filled my body and without even thinking I punched her directly in her face and starting screaming again as her body dropped to the ground. I took her body and tied it to the bed and gagged her so that when she wakes up she can't open her stupid mouth and tell me to stop playing the most amazing game know as Monopoly for the Nintendo Switch. After about five games with myself I started to calm down and I started to realize that life will be okay because I have Monopoly and I never have to stop playing. Its in the middle of the sixth game that my mom wakes up and I start to her her muffled screams and I tell her that she better shut up or I'll never let her go. After that she quiets down but little does she know that I will never let her go, I cannot risk letting her, or anyone for that matter, stop me from playing my game. Its now been ten days and I haven't stopped playing since I woke up that day I've lost track of how many games I've played. I haven't left my house and my friends seem to be worried about me because they've called my phone multiple times in the past hour but I don't have time to talk to people who don't love Monopoly the way I do. My mother stopped moving two days ago and is starting to smell but I don't care because I have everything I need, Monopoly.

Putting Balls in Neko Jaws
It is rare that a video game makes me cry, and Nekopara was honestly the last place on earth where I expected this would happen. First off, I really enjoyed the cute graphics (sadly no ultra wide support), the dialogues are well thought out and the voice acting is overall very enjoyable (props to the person who voiced the fly!). What really went under my skin tough was how Chocolat and Vanilla express their affection and loyalty towards their master time and time again. I was especially surprised how sensual and honestly the scene was conveyed where Chocolat confesses her feelings for her master. It didn't feel distasteful or weird, but rather invoked a feeling of self-reflection in me, and I realized that being almost in my 40s, I will probably continue to live miserably until I die alone and unloved, while tears started to run down my face.  Well played Nekopara, well played. You took me to places I didn't expect nor wanted to experience, for that alone you deserve a solid 10/10.

Cute Catpanions I like this game, it's so cute And the dlc, well good for keeping me awake o.o
[b] Do you like catgirls? [/b] [b] Do you like anime? [/b] [b] Do you feel lonely and want to fill the void in your heart somehow? [/b] If you answered "yes" to at least one of these questions, then chances are you're going to like this game.  [h1] Overview [/h1] This visual novel follows the story of Minaduki Kashou, a man who wants to open his own patisserie. As he moves out of his family home, where catgirls reside along with him and his sister, he finds out two of the catgirls, Chocola and Vanilla, have decided to follow him, as they do not wish to be separated from him.  [h1] Story [/h1] The story is one the main points of focus of this game, it isn't complicated, and it doesn't have any sorrow instigating drama. While things don't always go perfectly, this story is one of those that just make you feel warm inside.  [h1] Gameplay [/h1] It is a visual novel, so the gameplay is about what you'd probably expect. Simple and compact, as that is all it needs to be.  [h1] Visuals and Audio [/h1] The art style and animations are very pleasant to the eye. The adorable catgirls' faces are bound to cleanse your soul. The UI is simple and attractively looking, though it might take a bit to get used to it at first. As for the voice acting, it is very well done, as you would find out especially if you had the 18+ patch.  [h1] Conclusion [/h1] It's a very enjoyable experience and I believe it is worth the 9,99€ you pay for this.

⠀⠀⠀⢻⣿⣿⣿⣄⢂⠀⢠⣟⠔⠁⣰⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⡟⢀⠏⣀⠞⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠈⠀⠀⠀⣿⠀⢸⣿⣟⠀⢣⠀⡰⠁⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠈⠉⠛⠛⠛⠛⠊⢸⣿⡝ ⠀⠀⠀⠀⢻⣿⣿⣿⣆⢃⢸⡏⢀⣾⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣧⣾⣿⡁⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠘⣧⢸⣿⡟⠀⠸⠊⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⣼⣿⣷ ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⢻⣿⣿⣿⡞⡔⣣⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣄⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⣠⠀⠘⠻⡼⣇⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⡞⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⣿⢻⣿ ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⢻⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣆⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⢀⠇⠀⠀⠀⠑⠌⠢⠀⣀⣀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⣽⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⢰⣿⢸⣿ i am now a heroin addict.
Good Evening, My Fellow Citizens: This government, as promised, has maintained the closest surveillance of the Soviet military buildup on the island of Cuba. Within the past week, unmistakable evidence has established the fact that a series of offensive missile sites is now in preparation on that imprisoned island. The purpose of these bases can be none other than to provide a nuclear strike capability against the Western Hemisphere. Upon receiving the first preliminary hard information of this nature last Tuesday morning at 9 a.m., I directed that our surveillance be stepped up. And having now confirmed and completed our evaluation of the evidence and our decision on a course of action, this government feels obliged to report this new crisis to you in fullest detail. The characteristics of these new missile sites indicate two distinct types of installations. Several of them include medium range ballistic missiles, capable of carrying a nuclear warhead for a distance of more than 1,000 nautical miles. Each of these missiles, in short, is capable of striking Washington, D.C., the Panama Canal, Cape Canaveral, Mexico City, or any other city in the southeastern part of the United States, in Central America or in the Caribbean area.  Additional sites not yet completed appear to be designed for intermediate range ballistic missiles -- capable of traveling more than twice as far -- and thus capable of striking most of the major cities in the Western Hemisphere, ranging as far north as Hudson Bay, Canada, and as far south as Lima, Peru. In addition, jet bombers capable of carrying nuclear weapons are now being uncrated and assembled in Cuba while the necessary air bases are being prepared. This urgent transformation of Cuba into an important strategic base -- by the presence of these large, long-range, and clearly offensive weapons of sudden mass destruction -- constitutes an explicit threat to the peace and security of all Americas, in flagrant and deliberate defiance of the Rio Pact of 1947, the traditions of this nation and hemisphere, the joint resolution of the 87th Congress, the Charter of the United Nations, and my own public warnings to the Soviets on September 4 and 13. This action also contradicts the repeated assurances of Soviet spokesmen, both publicly and privately delivered, that the arms buildup in Cuba would retain its original defensive character, and that the Soviet Union had no need or desire to station strategic missiles on the territory of any other nation. ... But this secret, swift and extraordinary buildup of communist missiles -- in an area well known to have a special and historical relationship to the United States and the nations of the Western Hemisphere, in violation of Soviet assurances, and in defiance of American and hemispheric policy -- the sudden, clandestine decision to station strategic weapons for first time outside of Soviet soil -- is a deliberately provocative and unjustified change in the status quo which cannot be accepted by this country, if our courage and our commitments are ever to be trusted again by either friend or foe. ... Acting, therefore, in the defense of our own security and of the entire Western Hemisphere, and under the authority entrusted to me by the Constitution as endorsed by the resolution of the Congress, I have directed that the following initial steps be taken immediately: First: To halt this offensive buildup, a strict quarantine on all offensive military equipment under shipment to Cuba is being initiated. All ships of any kind bound for Cuba from whatever nation and port will, if found to contain cargoes of offensive weapons, be turned back. This quarantine will be extended, if needed, to other types of cargo and carriers. We are not at this time, however, denying the necessities of life as the Soviets attempted to do in their Berlin blockade of 1948.  Second: I have directed the continued and increased close surveillance of Cuba and its military buildup. The foreign ministers of the OAS, in their communique of October 6, rejected secrecy on such matters in this hemisphere. Should these offensive military preparations continue, thus increasing the threat to the hemisphere, further action will be justified. I have directed the Armed Forces to prepare for any eventualities; and I trust that in the interest of both the Cuban people and the Soviet technicians at the sites, the hazards to all concerned of continuing the threat will be recognized. Third: It shall be the policy of this nation to regard any nuclear missile launched from Cuba against any nation in the Western Hemisphere as an attack on the United States, requiring a full retaliatory response upon the Soviet Union. Fourth: As a necessary military precaution, I have reinforced our base at Guantanamo, evacuated today the dependents of our personnel there, and ordered additional military units to be on a standby alert status. Fifth: We are calling tonight for an immediate meeting of the Organ of Consultation under the Organization of American States, to consider this threat to hemispheric security and to invoke articles 6 and 8 of the Rio Treaty in support of all necessary action. The United Nations Charter allows for regional security arrangements -- and the nations of this hemisphere decided long ago against the military presence of outside powers. Our other allies around the world have also been alerted. Sixth: Under the Charter of the United Nations, we are asking tonight that an emergency meeting of the Security Council be convoked without delay to take action against this latest Soviet threat to world peace. Our resolution will call for the prompt dismantling and withdrawal of all offensive weapons in Cuba, under the supervision of U.N. observers, before the quarantine can be lifted. Seventh and finally: I call upon Chairman Khrushchev to halt and eliminate this clandestine, reckless, and provocative threat to world peace and to stable relations between our two nations. I call upon him further to abandon this course of world domination, and to join in an historic effort to end the perilous arms race and to transform the history of man. He has an opportunity now to move the world back from the abyss of destruction -- by returning to his government's own words that it had no need to station missiles outside its own territory, and withdrawing these weapons from Cuba -- by refraining from any action which will widen or deepen the present crisis -- and then by participating in a search for peaceful and permanent solutions. ... My fellow citizens: let no one doubt that this is a difficult and dangerous effort on which we have set out. No one can foresee precisely what course it will take or what costs or casualties will be incurred. Many months in which both our patience and our will will be tested -- months in which many threats and denunciations will keep us aware of our dangers. But the greatest danger of all would be to do nothing. ...  Our goal is not the victory of might, but the vindication of right -- not peace at the expense of freedom, but both peace and freedom, here in this hemisphere, and we hope, around the world. God willing, that goal will be achieved. Thank you and good night.

Bought it with reluctance. I now regret nothing.
[b]November 25th, 2021[/b]  "I guess now that we've come full circle, I should get you Volume 1 for the complete set, right?"  Again, I cannot verify that this was exactly what was said, but rather, an approximation. Another friend of mine that watched me read through Volumes 2, 3, and 4 was eagerly waiting in anticipation for my read-through of Volume 1, so he said something along these lines. A different friend had picked up the demo for this game, and I watched him go through this time (albeit only for a little bit, as I played through Volume 1 a bit later).  I was ready for a well deserved break following the rare strain of cringe that was Volume 4. Of course, that break didn't last very long. I was ready to get back into this series once again, but this time I took a little detour before getting back into the Visual Novels. I had discovered that there was not one, but MULTIPLE anime adaptations, the most prominent of which was by Funimation and not some rinky-dink backwater studio. I realized now that what I was dealing with was way bigger than I had initially thought, and was not just some niche indie project that had a small following. This series has sold 5 MILLION copies across 6 games, which blew my initial estimates out of the fucking water.  I watched the first few episodes of the Funimation anime (I eventually did finish it), and my expectations for how much I could cringe at a piece of media were proverbially flattened by an imaginary steamroller disguising itself as anime (I don't really care too much about anime as a genre one way or the other, but I can now see why some call it a 'mistake'). I knew I needed some more preparation before I could face this series again, so I decided to go with something more "tame" and watched the OVA.  However, when I watched the OVA, I noticed that the beginning was very similar to the demo of Volume 1 that my friend had played just days prior. I had now mistakenly obtained most of the knowledge I would've received from Volume 1 by watching an OVA that was one-fifth as long. The problem with this is that now I essentially had no reason to sit through Volume 1, making my experience with this game a particularly boring one.  But before I go into my actual thoughts on Volume 1 as a game, let's string off into yet another aspect of the series that spans more than just the volume in question. Now that I have exhausted the "gameplay", music, and main characters, lets talk about something more juicy that relates to the knowledge that this specific volume gifts you; (*cue fanfare*) the ethics of catgirls!   After my experience with Volume 2, I needed to know a few things about this universe, and most key among them were "What are catgirls anyway? Have they always been here? Were they engineered somehow? What sort of genetic makeup are we looking at here? Do humans reproduce with cat-people?"  I'm happy to report that finally, after 3 games and zero answers, Volume 1 has finally given me what I was looking for. (I know I could've started at the beginning and found this out a lot sooner, but don't forget that I wasn't originally expecting to play through the entire series)  What I am less happy to report, however, is what the answer actually is. I can sum it up for you in 4 words, taken from the actual game (yes, I did open it again for this review in order to check).  "genetically modified humanoid cats"  At first, genetically modifying cats sounds pretty bad, in my opinion. However, consider the alternative: "genetically modified catlike humans" instantly becomes way worse than modified cats, because that would involve some form of human genetic experimentation, possibly on live subjects, which is certainly not something one should be thinking of while one of the results of these experiments is loudly asking the main character about menstrual pads in public. However, this means that cat-people were [b]created[/b] to be human-like, but beneath humanity as a sub-class of citizen, which is a tragic tale when put in that context.  But now, there comes a new dilemma: what if instead of animal experimentation they instead decided to trace the origin story to cat-people that evolved naturally? Well that opens a new can of worms in the game's universe, since if you remember my volume 2 review, I discussed that the society is set up very similar to a slave society, with catgirls legally unable to do anything independently (a situation that is relevant in Volume 1, surprisingly). So now, the human race essentially has enslaved parts of themselves and cast one race on top of another as the "owners" while independence of the lower caste is illegal, and I don't think I need to explain why that's bad.  That leaves us between a rock and a hard place in how to approach the origins of catgirls. Either they were created in a lab with animal experimentation with the expressed purpose of creating a new pet with human features (often to used to fulfill some kind of sexual fantasy), stripping them of rights that would ordinarily be granted to humans (and since it is revealed that catgirls were typically homeless strays until recently, neglected by the very experiment that brought them into existence), [i]OR[/i], there is a forceful enslavement of humans over cat-people, dehumanizing them and restricting their independence until they are little more than common pets. Nekopara has elected to adopt the first option as the canonical origin story, but both of these options are questionable, neither of which, in my opinion, take a clear moral high ground over the other.   But enough of my silly rant, let's examine the game now, shall we.  As I mentioned earlier, I had seen the OVA before playing Volume 1, so I already knew what was going to happen, and the experience was relatively boring compared to going in without previous knowledge. However, even in isolation of this fact, Volume 1 is easily the weakest of the main Nekopara series (I say 'main' because there is a worse entry with the "Nekopara" name). The story was the least interesting, largely settling into generic misadventures with Chocola and Vanilla, with occasional references to their backstory and strong attachment to Kashou, which largely feel shoehorned in and contrast poorly with the rest of the story. The only part I'd call passable is the ending, when the catgirls commit a felony by leaving the house without bells, and even then it wasn't very good. I largely feel this was done poorly because Chocola and Vanilla are not well written characters in Volume 1. They lack little human characteristics to make them feel real, which I guess was kind of the point in making them cats. However, later games in the series take more and more gradual steps to make the catgirls feel more human, which makes for more interesting stories later down the line. Even Chocola and Vanilla receive some of these characteristics in later entries (and even the anime, to an extent), and that ultimately improves the quality of these characters. Their characters in Volume 1, however, boil down to little more than "I wuv master uwu cuz he took care of me when I was sick :3 and i wanna have sexy time with him~". I wish there was more to it than that, but other than that, their characters are literally no different than an actual cat; acting on their instincts with 0 regard for those around them, a characteristic even a side character catgirl (who came back in volume 2 renamed "Milk") is better at hiding than these two.  I was unimpressed by Volume 1, and had I started here the proper way instead of looping around via later games I'd likely be unmotivated to continue. However, in this game I received answers to many (but not all) of my questions that had been lingering since I started with Volume 2, which I consider both a blessing and a curse thanks to this. My journey is still not over, but the end is in sight.  tl;dr: nya nya catgirl game 1 answers questions but is boring. watch OVA instead. 4/10
What if all our technology were designed by people who love us? How would the world be different? Who do you wish would make it for you? Who would you make it for? Enter NEKOPARA- of the people, by the people, for the people.
The game is amazing and adorable

playing this on valentines so i can be with my cat wives  ⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄ ⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄ ⠄⠄⠛⢻⣿⣯⣿⣿⣿⣶⣶⣶⣶⣤⣤⣤⣀⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄ ⠄⠄⠄⢨⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣷⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄ ⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠈⠻⣿⡛⠉⠭⠉⠉⢉⣿⣿⣧⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄ ⠄⠄⠈⠙⠲⣶⠖⠄⠄⢿⣿⠄⠶⣶⣾⣿⣿⣿⣿⣧⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄ ⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠈⠄⠄⠄⠺⢿⡗⠄⣹⣿⣿⠿⣟⣿⡏⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄ ⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠤⠤⢾⣿⣿⣿⣦⠘⡿⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄ ⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠈⢻⡿⣷⣶⣶⣤⣤⣤⣶⣦⠁⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄ ⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⣽⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⡟⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄ ⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠘⠿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⣿⠃⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄ ⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠉⠉⠛⠋⠉⠁⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄⠄

You just click and the story continues.)  The storyline is very well written and I would recommend playing it at least once for the experience. for the people who want sexual content the DLC has you covered (there is no sexual scenes without the DLC but it is very heavily implied without it). Would recommend playing nekopara 0 first before you play nekopara 1 to understand whats going on. In my personal opinion I would recommend buying it if you are interested in these types of games or content. The catgirls are compared to daughters immediately after a sex scene ([spoiler]since Kashou did raise them from their childhood, oh also they're twin sisters yet they interact sexually with each other[/spoiler]). They occasionally say "no, stop" during sex which isn't respected at all, and they're extremely shrill and high-pitched during it. They act young and naive, almost child-like at times, [spoiler]because catgirls have less intelligence than humans[/spoiler], which is not a turn-on at all. Very Enlightening
a
Lol not sure how this game ended up in my library but what can I say... It's a very shallow game that goes all in on the cutesy stuff, so if you're not into it than there is not much else there unfortunately. Most of the games budget is spent on the animation and music, both of which are actually pretty good, comparable to most anime of its genre. Where the game falls short however is the lack of player interaction, in that there really isn't anything for the player to do other than turn the page. This is a short coming that games like "Doki doki Literature club", or "Long live the Queen" really understood and addressed to such an impressive degree that they put many of these older titles to shame. I could also complain about the nonsense dialogue or the lack of a story but then again I don't understand women or cats in real life either so maybe it adds up, and I've also seen worse writing than Nekopara... looking at you "Cats 2019"

Imma be honest here between all these meme reviews:  I played the whole thing and it was really fun. While i installed the uncut-patch, i did so mainly because i heard dialogue and certain jokes would also be censored. But the H-Scenes are pretty good nonetheless.   Anyway, it´s a cute story. I enjoyed playing (well more like reading) through it. The Live2D adds a lot. Other VNs are a lot more static and feel like more of a drag. Even the sound-design was pretty good for something that simple. I really liked it for it´s story, which probably nobody will ever believe.   It was short, well and thoughtfully presented and extremely sweet.

I constructed a gaming rig, comprised of money I had saved up for some time. I wanted to be spec'd out so I got everything, I7-7700k, with an AIO liquid cooler running 5.0ghz, A GTX 1080 Ti FE running stock clocks, 16 gb of 3200 mhz ram, an m.2 ssd,an awesome RGB Msi motherboard, a Thermaltake case with GPU sidemounting. Don't let the 720p graphics and outdated petting mechanics fool ya, this game is deep and the world is really immersive. The beginning feels magical as you get off the car and see the bizarre world of Patisserie La Soleil for the first time. SO MANY UNIQUE CATGURLS, MEOWS, PURRS, GURUGURUGURUS which in my opinion Amairo Chocolate / Neko-NIN (mostly Amairo Chocolate) could have enhanced on much better, but those feel like a generic catgurl setting and a little lacking on that (of course those 2 games have something unique about them too). This game on the other hand is unique in so many ways that you just got to play it. The soundtrack is as good (if not better) as the other games, and they are so befitting of the themes of NEKOPARA. The game does a really good job of taking you from a low level bakery owner to basically a bakery demigod  Generally speaking: this game is unique and amazing. Play it. the low-res graphics and mechanics sometimes are a turn off, and imo just try bearing with it because nearing the middle / end of the game the game just gets better and fun. use Chest Bounciness (a slider that improves the games graphics and bewba fixes) if you are ok not having the "vanilla experience".  100/10 (a 4K version of the game would be so cool!) suprisingly good story
The time has finally come... Nearly 5 years after initially launching Nekopara, I finally finished it. Don't ask me how  time flew by this quick with me postponing it, but you know what they say... If you start doing too many new things you tend to not finish em all, so after I now gave it a revisit, there was no doubt in my mind about finishing it once and for all and there is no doubt in my mind that I will shortly after finish the rest of the volumes as well! Now with the talk of personal nostalgia and love for the series out of the way, lets talk about what makes Nekopara so great. I mean you already know it, but this is a recommending review... This is where I give out all the praise for the visual novel like Kashou gives his praise to Chocola and Vanilla. The artwork is and will always be ridiculously cute. The soundtrack makes you move along and the interface, the visuals are one of the prettiest and cleanest I've seen in a visual novel. The characters show various movement; when they talk, expressions, when they move from one place to another etc. ALSO JIGGLE PHYSICS!! Can't forget about the jiggles. The characters (mainly Chocola and Vanilla of course) are beyond cute [spoiler]and so is the love between themselves and Kashou[/spoiler]. It seriously melts your heart to a point of even a little bit of jealousy; who wouldn't wanna be there and just cuddle the two catgirls for hours on end. Its a great love story, really. However, Id be lying if I said I came for the love story. You come for the sex scenes and you stay for the love story..... and the scenes.. POINT IS! The scenes are the longest and most passionate (AND partially animated) I've seen so far in a visual novel, and really make you feel as lewd as the characters are in the moment, or so I liked to think anyway.  Very cute and heartwarming love story and artstyle, combined with extremely lewd, cute and sexy scenes of love making, not to mention last but in no way least, CATGIRLS. All weeb jokes aside, you can't deny that a catgirl (or two) is all you need (cause they're unobtainable, coming back to earth *bonk*) and clearly superior in cuteness levels to any normal girl. This is without a doubt one of my favourite visual novel series and aside from the infamous mosaic censor (damn you, laws of Japan!), I really have no complaints. 11/10.

Excellent characters, excellent music and astoudingly good art. One of the most high-quality, high-effort Visual Novels I've played in some time.   I'd really advise against getting the +18 patch though. A lot of people could argue that the whole "heat" arc was essential to the plot, but I think these were made just for the sake of fanservice and do not actually contribute anything meaningful to the story or overall game. They're just SO stretched out, awkward and plain unpleasant. One of the few ocassions where I would intentionally turn down and skip hentai scenes in a VN, or any game for that matter.  Aside from that though, it's a solid 8/10. Definitely worth the purchase

Let me spin you a tale of my life. Back when I was a lad somewhere in my first or second year of highschool a friend said, "hey, do you want Nekopara?" and I, being the innocent pure lad I was, said "sure" because I thought, "man this'll be funny to have." So I had it, and I sat on it, then sometime later I say "haha you know what would be really funny? If I got all the achievements" so I booted up Nekopara and spammed my way through the game, ultimately taking up three hours of my life. All achievements unlocked and three hours on my account. It was at that point that I realized something. How can people tell I was joking? I tell friends this story but part of me worries "what if they don't believe me? what if people start thinking that I actually wanted a visual novel about catgirls? What do I do now?" To tell you the truth I still have no answer to that question, but, it was free, and it led to a friend gifting me "Slender: Hentai Edition" several years later. So, in the end I may forever be tainted in the eyes of others, but I got free stuff, and for me, the greedy rat bastard I am, that's a good deal. But to be completely honest, do I recommend this? Eh, it's not really my thing, but if you're reading reviews with the hope of finding out if it's actually good or not I just gotta say: come on man. You know what you're getting, descend into degeneracy or rise above us plebians who forever have our libraries stained by the Japanese catgirls.
(pro tip) lock your door before playing

i saw cat boobs
This game saved my life.  I am 31.  My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and adopted our son together. They are now both 4 years old.  When we were going through our separation, I found myself lost and miserable. I was self destructive. I got so mad one day from everything spiraling out of my control that I punched some concrete in a moment of overwhelming emotion. That caused me to break my 5th metacarpal in my right hand... my working hand... my games hand.. the hand that I held and carried my children to bed with.. The hand I desperately needed to make sure I could continue to provide.  After learning of the severity of my self-inflicted damage, I was borderline suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man with no history of depression or anxiety. I have never had fits of rage, or been one to break down and cry, but I was in a low spot that just really buried me from being able to see the light on the other side.  Having nothing better to do, I searched for a game I could play, ONE HANDED while I recovered. I somehow stumbled upon this game and read some of the reviews. I decided that it had to be worth a shot... I must admit, I didn't beat the game, or play nearly as long as some of you. In fact, I may have only played this game a day or two.. With that being said, after doing so, I had a new found joy and hope for life. I was able to put behind me the pain and suffering that had been cast over me. I was able to experience other peoples joy and happiness. I was able to see the fruits of my "labor". I relaxed for 5 :hillary: :hillary: :hillary: :hillary: :hillary: :hillary: :hillary: minutes to this music long enough to realize that I was going to be okay. After coming to that realization, I turned the game off, and I went back to work. It hurt my hand like hell but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so damn sorry for myself, and I became the father I needed to be in that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving as.  Today, I am close friend with my kids mother. We don't fight, or argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents, and friends.  I now have 3 kids. My third child is, wait for it, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my own separation, and we just stumbled in to each others life unexpectedly. We have been in a relationship for a year now, and are very happy together.  Moral of the story, you never know what life holds in store for you, and if I would have given up when all the odds were stacked against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.  Thank you

:)
So, in short this is a high quality 4-6 hour erotic Visual Novel for cat lovers. If you have a cat, you'll like this game.  [Noteworthy Stuff]:  -You need to buy an 18+ patch to scene any lewd content.  -There's a total of 3 s*x scenes that play out towards the later hours, all of which you can revisit in a CG Gallery, Scene Gallery, and Video Gallery at the title screen. They're mostly pictures but a few parts in the scenes have *thrusting*. All 3 are fairly long with quite a bit of text and dialogue to go with it.  -Fully voiced (in Japanese) for all characters except you (i read my parts out loud for deeper immersion) [but i read them in english so idk if my catgirls understood me...]  -At the title screen, in 'Extras', there's a CG Gallery, Scene Gallery, Music Gallery, And Video Gallery. They all unlock as you progress.  -There's a slider where you can adjust how bouncy the breasts are. Also, press P at any given time to make them bounce at will. With great power, comes great responsibility... (!!!)  -It's a straight VN, so there's no interaction or dialogue options. It's pretty text heavy and you gotta play a while before you hit the lewd scenes. Think of it like a manga but with jiggle physics ^.^  -There's a Log where you can backtrack to re-read stuff but no 'back' button to rewind scenes like in other VN's. There's also an auto-forward mode with it's own settings (for hands-free play) and a Skip button that only works after you've passed a scene once.  Lastly, I'd strongly recommend getting this on sale because of the length and price. Especially because you're gonna want that 18+ patch that you have to buy on top of buying the game. Then you're gonna wanna buy Vol. 2, which also requires you to buy another 18+ patch. Then Vol. 3 and you get where this is going. So ya.   Meow on, cat daddies (and mommies) ^.^

After seeing all the accolades, I decided to take a chance when this title went on sale....and I now regret it.  First, if you are interested in this title for its erotic content, know ahead of time that this content was completely removed by Steam.  If you desire that content, you need to go to the developer's website and pay $10 for a patch to restore the content.  Second, if you are interested in this title for its storyline, I personally found it dull and tiresome.  Seiously, the story basically goes like this:  Vanilla:  Master, can we have shampoo for our hair? Chocola: You are mean!  We want shampoo for our hair! Narrator:  We did not come to the market to buy shampoo. Vanilla: (whines) But we want shampoo! Chocola:  The shampoo makes our hair nice. Both: PLEASE! Narrator: No, we are here to buy grocieries.  and on.....and on...and on....  This isn't quite verbatim, but it's an accurate reflection.  Third, if you're interested in the anime graphics, they are fine, but I've seen both far better and far worse.  Admittedly, I could invest more hours of my life into this "game" and hope it gets better, but since the beginning failed to grab my attention (the first rule of writing a good book is to seize the reader's attention--because this is really a book, not a game), it doesn't bode well.  I do not recommend it.  EDIT:   I forced myself to finish Nekopara 1.  It does eventually get better, and there are some erotic scenes, but you have to grind through a lot of annoying dialogue to get there.  I'm currently playing Nekopara 2 which gets to the action more quickly.  There's enough dialogue to develop the characters without it getting annoying.  I think that the developers learned from the first one and made the second one better.
